statement:
The field of rational numbers has no other valuations than

-   the trivial valuation,

-   the absolute value, i.e. the complex modulus $|\cdot|_\infty$ and

-   the $p$-adic valuations $|\cdot|_p$ when $p$ goes through all
    positive primes.

**Note.** Any valuation $|\cdot|$ of the field $\mathbb{Q}$ defines a
metric $d(x,\,y) = |x-y|$ in the field, but $\mathbb{Q}$ is only with
respect to (the “trivial metric” defined by) the trivial valuation. The
field has the proper completions with respect to its other valuations:
the field of reals $\mathbb{R}$ and the fields $\mathbb{Q}_p$ of ; cf.
also .
